clinical_study.brief_title: Hydromorphone vs Fentanyl in Children Undergoing Tonsillectomy Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial to Compare Hydromorphone vs Fentanyl in Children Undergoing Tonsillectomy Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: A RCT to compare hydromorphone versus fentanyl for pain control following tonsillectomy or adenotonsillectomy surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized clinical trial with masked assessment, comparing recovery indices for patients receiving intermediate acting versus short acting opioid analgesia using hydromorphone or fentanyl as intraoperative analgesics. An otherwise standardized anesthetic and analgesic regimen will be utilized, consistent with routine care at SLCH. Patients will be randomized 1:1 in block sizes of 5 per group. Patients will be randomized to receive either hydromorphone or fentanyl throughout the perioperative period by opening a sealed protocol envelope.

secondary_outcome.measure: Preoperative Amsterdam Preoperative Anxiety Scale - hydromorphone group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 12 hours prior to surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Caregiver of the participant is asked questions regarding the child's anxiety level prior to surgery. The questions asked: 1) I am worried about the anesthetic, 2) The anesthetic is on my mind continually, 3) I would like to know as much as possible about the anesthetic, 4) I am worried about the procedure, 5) The procedure is on my mind continually, 6) I would like to know as much as possible about the procedure The measure of agreement with these statements should be graded on a 5-point Likert scale from 1 "not at all" to 5 "extremely." A score of ≥11 identify anxious patients in clinical practice.

secondary_outcome.measure: Yale Preoperative Anxiety Scale - hydromorphone group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 12 hours prior to surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing child anxiety during the induction of anesthesia. It contains 22 items in 5 categories: activity, emotional expressivity, state of arousal, vocalization, and use of parents. Each category receives a score on a scale of 0 to 4 (6 for vocalization) according to the behavior of the patient, with 0 = no anxiety and 4 (or 6 for vocalization) = high anxiety.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Children ages 2 to 15 years old
2. Presenting for tonsillectomy or adenotonsillectomy surgery
3. American Society of Anesthesiologists Physical Status (ASAPS) Classification 1, 2 or 3
4. Provide Informed Consent / Assent (as appropriate)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Additional Concurrent surgeries, exclusive of myringotomy tubes
2. Any condition which would make the participant, in the opinion of the investigator, unsuitable for the study.
